required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Health Literacy Among Arab Women in East Jerusalem
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Health Literacy Among Arab Women in East Jerusalem

brief_summary.textblock:
Health literacy (HL) is defined as skills and competencies enabling people to obtain and interpret health information and apply their knowledge to inform health-related decision-making. It's also defined as "the degree to which individuals have the capacity to obtain, understand, and process basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions".
Health literacy is defined in the Healthy People 2020 objectives of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services as "the capacity to obtain, interpret and understand basic health information and services and the competence to use such information and services to enhance health". The concept of health literacy was defined more broadly in the World Health Organization Health Promotion Glossary as "the development of the cognitive and social skills which determine the motivation and ability of individuals to gain access to, understand and use information in ways that promote and maintain good health". Arab women in East Jerusalem are at high risk of low health literacy due to lower levels of education and low socio-economic status. According to a study published by the Brookdale institution, Arab communities in Israel have lower health literacy and reduced knowledge of the relation between certain behaviors and their effect on health. They found as well that most of the health materials and brochures available in Arabic are poorly translated from another language, which may lead to unintentional misrepresentation and loss of content. In addition, these translated materials are often culturally inappropriate and full of medical jargon that is difficult for the layperson to understand. A cross-sectional national survey was conducted by Clalit Health Services on 600 Clalit Members (57% female), using an adapted research instrument which included Health Literacy Survey-Europe -Q-16 (HLS-EU-Q-16.) This study reported significant differences between Arab and non-Arab Clalit members in three of the 16 questions, including perceived difficulty in understanding the way to treat health problems, difficulty in coping with mental health problems and stress management. The study population included a very small and non-representative sampling of Arabs of East Jerusalem. In summary, very little is known about the health literacy level of Arab women in East Jerusalem.

detailed_description.textblock:
The proposed study consists of a limited assessment of the health literacy needs of Arab women in East Jerusalem. This will be assessed through qualitative data collection. Six different focus groups will be conducted at three of the six municipality community centers in East Jerusalem.
Recruitment Investigators will recruitment participants through the identified community centers. Participants will participate in focus groups at the community center.
Focus groups: Each group will meet once for up to two hours. The study will be explained to them by an investigator who has been trained in the administration of focus groups, and they will be asked to sign a consent form. Once they have signed, the investigator will begin asking them prepared questions concerning health issues. The meeting will be recorded without the names of the participants (they will be instructed not to use their names once the recording begins). At the end of the meeting, each participant will receive a bag and pamphlets with information regarding women's health.
Sample and Sample Size Calculation The size of each focus group will be around 127 Arab women attending the three different community centers in East Jerusalem (AL-Tur, Shufat, and Issawiyeh). Two focus groups will be done in each community center (six8 focus groups). (investigators will recruit up to 72 women)
Interventions The study consists of data collection for qualitative evaluation and assessment, aiming to assess the level of health literacy in Arab women in East Jerusalem

primary_outcome.measure: assessment of health literacy level and elucidate factors that will improve health literacy (barriers, incentives, etc.â€¦) among Arab women in East Jerusalem
primary_outcome.description: the assessment will be done through conduction of focus groups. Focus groups will be audio- recorded, transcribed and analyzed using Systematic text condensation, a descriptive and explorative analysis strategy. Which consists of four steps: 1) total impression - from chaos to themes; 2) identifying and sorting meanings units - from themes to codes; 3) condensation - from code to meaning; 4) synthesizing - from condensation to descriptions and concepts. It is expected that six focus groups will be sufficient to achieve saturation of themes. If results are not sufficient, investigators will ask to increase the number of focus groups.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arab Women health literacy focus groups
arm_group.description: Arab women in East Jerusalem will be part of focus groups. investigators will be administrating pre-prepared questions. The focus groups will be recorded and analyzed by the researchers.

intervention.intervention_name: Heath literacy assessment in Arab women in East Jerusalem
intervention.description: The intervention is purely for evaluation and assessment, aiming to assess the level of health literacy in Arab women in East Jerusalem for designing future programs following the assessment results.
intervention.arm_group_label: Arab Women health literacy focus groups

criteria.textblock:
Inclusionary Criteria:
- All women aged 18-85 that attend and participate in the community's women's groups
- They must speak Arabic and be willing to be recorded.
Exclusionary Criteria:
- Not in the age range of 18-85.
- do not speak Arabic.
- Participants are not willing to be recorded.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of Linda Joy Pollin Cardiovascular Wellness Center for Women
